A comparison of expert elicitation and model
forecasts of the future cost of technologies for the energy transition indicates that model
medians were closer to the average realized values in 2019
Recent studies attempt to separate the influence of learning
versus other factors in explaining cost reduct
ions specifically in energy technologies. Some studies
explain cost reductions with two factors: cumulative deployment (as proxy for experience) and R&D
cannot be precisely assigned to specific industrial sectors or sub
curve studies take into account that historical variation in
technology costs could be explained by variation in key materials

Determinants of technological change direction: prices, market size and government
Firms change their choice of technology upon change in prices: when one input (e.g. energy) becomes
relatively expensive, firms pick technologies wh
ich allow them to economize on that input, according
. For example, an increase in oil price will lead to a choice of fuel
